sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词或词组均含有"召集，召唤"之意。
means: call ： 非正式用词，含义广泛，指用说话或呼叫的形式召唤。
summon ： 正式用词，指官方或正式的召集，召集者具有权力或权威性。
send for ： 作"召唤"解时，语气较随便，暗示委派一件工作。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词都有"喊，叫"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: cry, shout, exclaim, roar, scream, shriek, yell, call
means: cry ： 一般指因恐惧、痛苦、惊奇等而喊叫。
shout ： 指有意识地高声喊叫，常用于提出警告、发命令或唤起注意等。
exclaim ： 多指因高兴、愤怒、痛苦、惊讶等突发感情而高声喊叫。
roar ： 指发出大而深沉的声音、吼叫或咆哮。
scream ： 指因恐具、快乐或痛苦而发出的尖叫声。
shriek ： 指因惊恐、痛苦等或其它感情而发出比scream更为尖锐、刺耳的叫声。
yell ： 多指求援、鼓励时的呼叫。也可指因外界因素刺激而发出尖厉声音。
call ： 指大声说话或喊叫，以引起某人的注意。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"命名，称呼"之意。
means: name ： 含义最泛，指给人或物命名以示区别或便于记忆。
call ： 指给某人或某物取名字以某人或某物的特征称呼。
designate ： 指用特别的名字、符号或词句来称某人或某物。

entry.def: If you call someone or something by a particular name or title, you give them that name or title.
entry.tran: 叫;称呼;将…命名;给…起名字

example.ex: I always wanted to call the dog Mufty for some reason...
example.tran: 不知怎么的,我老想把这条狗唤作穆夫提。

example.ex: 'Doctor...' — 'Will you please call me Sarah?'...
example.tran: “大夫…”——“就叫我萨拉好了。”

entry.def: If you call someone or something a particular thing, you suggest they are that thing or describe them as that thing.

example.ex: The speech was interrupted by members of the Conservative Party, who called him a traitor...
example.tran: 演说被保守党人士打断,他们称他是叛徒。

example.ex: I wouldn't call it a burden; I call it a responsibility...
example.tran: 我不觉得这是负担;我觉得它是一种责任。

entry.def: If you call something, you say it in a loud voice, because you are trying to attract someone's attention.

example.ex: He could hear the others downstairs in different parts of the house calling his name...
example.tran: 他听到其他人从楼下不同地方喊他的名字。

example.ex: 'Boys!' she called again.
example.tran: “小子们!”她又叫道。

entry.def: If you call someone, you telephone them.

example.ex: Would you call me as soon as you find out?...
example.tran: 你一弄清楚了就给我打电话好吗?

example.ex: A friend of mine gave me this number to call...
example.tran: 一个朋友要我打这个号码。

entry.def: If you call someone such as a doctor or the police, you ask them to come to you, usually by telephoning them.

example.ex: He screamed for his wife to call an ambulance...
example.tran: 他尖叫着让他老婆打电话叫救护车。

example.ex: One night he was called to see a woman with tuberculosis.
example.tran: 一天夜里,有人打来电话,请他去给一位患肺结核的妇女看病。

entry.def: If you call someone, you ask them to come to you by shouting to them.

example.ex: She called her young son: 'Here, Stephen, come and look at this!'...
example.tran: 她喊她的小儿子:“喂,斯蒂芬,过来看看这个!”

example.ex: He called me over the Tannoy.
example.tran: 他用天朗扩音器喊我。

entry.def: When you make a telephone call, you telephone someone.

example.ex: I made a phone call to the United States to talk to a friend...
example.tran: 我打电话给美国的一个朋友。

example.ex: I've had hundreds of calls from other victims...
example.tran: 我已经接到了其他受害人打来的上百个电话。

entry.def: If someone in authority calls something such as a meeting, rehearsal, or election, they arrange for it to take place at a particular time.
entry.tran: 召集(会议、排练等);宣布举行(选举等)

example.ex: The Committee decided to call a meeting of the All India Congress...
example.tran: 委员会决定召开国大党会议。

example.ex: The RSC was calling a press conference to announce the theatre's closure...
example.tran: 皇家莎士比亚剧团要召开新闻发布会,宣布剧院关闭。

entry.def: If someone is called before a court or committee, they are ordered to appear there, usually to give evidence.

example.ex: The child waited two hours before she was called to give evidence...
example.tran: 小女孩等了两个小时才被传唤进去作证。

example.ex: I was called as an expert witness.
example.tran: 我作为专家证人被传唤出庭。

entry.def: If you call somewhere, you make a short visit there.

example.ex: A market researcher called at the house where he was living...
example.tran: 一位市场调查人员造访了他的住处。

example.ex: Andrew now came almost weekly to call.
example.tran: 现在安德鲁几乎每星期都来。

entry.def: When a train, bus, or ship calls somewhere, it stops there for a short time to allow people to get on or off.
entry.tran: (火车、公共汽车、船舶)停靠,停留

example.ex: The steamer calls at several ports along the way.
example.tran: 一路上,汽船在好几个港口停靠。

entry.def: To call a game or sporting event means to cancel it, for example because of rain or bad light.

example.ex: The second game of the series had ended in a 3-3 tie after ten innings when the game was called on account of darkness...
example.tran: 系列赛第二场在十局过后,双方战成3比3平，此时由于天黑,比赛取消。

example.ex: We called the next game.
example.tran: 我们取消了下一场比赛。

entry.def: If there is a call for something, someone demands that it should happen.

example.ex: There have been calls for a new kind of security arrangement...
example.tran: 不少人呼吁出台新的安全措施。

example.ex: Almost all workers heeded a call by the trade unions to stay at home for the duration of the strike.
example.tran: 工会号召工人在罢工期间呆在家里,几乎所有工人都响应了这一号召。

entry.def: If there is little or no call for something, very few people want it to be done or provided.

example.ex: 'Have you got just plain chocolate?' — 'No, I'm afraid there's not much call for that.'
example.tran: “你们有纯巧克力吗?”——“没有,恐怕那东西没几个人要。”

entry.def: The call of something such as a place is the way it attracts or interests you strongly.

example.ex: You must be feeling exhilarated by the call of the new.
example.tran: 新鲜事物的魅力一定让你兴奋不已。

entry.def: The call of a particular bird or animal is the characteristic sound that it makes.

example.ex: ...the plaintive call of a whale.
example.tran: 鲸的哀鸣

example.ex: ...a wide range of animal noises and bird calls.
example.tran: 各种各样的鸟兽叫声

entry.def: If you have first call on something, you will be asked before anyone else whether you want to buy or use it.

example.ex: Why should they get first call on the best property?
example.tran: 凭什么最好的房产尽着他们先挑?

entry.def: If you say that there is no call for someone to behave in a particular way, you are criticizing their behaviour, usually because you think it is rude.

example.ex: There was no call for him to single you out from all the others.
example.tran: 这么多人中，他不该专挑你。

entry.def: If someone is on call, they are ready to go to work at any time if they are needed, especially if there is an emergency.
entry.tran: 随时待命的;随叫随到的

example.ex: In theory I'm on call day and night.
example.tran: 从理论上说,我现在昼夜待命。

example.ex: ...a doctor on call.
example.tran: 随叫随到的医生

entry.def: If you call in sick, you telephone the place where you work to tell them you will not be coming to work because you are ill.

example.ex: 'Shouldn't you be at work today?' — 'I called in sick.'
example.tran: “你今天不是应该上班的吗?”“我打电话请过病假了。”
